news-item.title: Future Retail Limited keeps sliding: down 3.5% in 3 days
news-item.source: Indian Company News Bites - Stock Report
news-item.text:
STOCK REPORT Future Retail Limited (NSE:FRL), India's 3rd largest department store company by market capitalisation, extended its slide Tuesday, shedding an additional Rs0.10 (or 0.1%) to close at Rs79.70. The shares have dropped Rs2.85 (or 3.5%) over the past three trading days. Compared with the BSE Sensex Index which fell 23.6 points (or 0.11%) in the three days, this represented a relative price change of -3.3%. To download our Detailed Research Report (PDF), giving comprehensive trading and background information on Future Retail Limited, please click http://www.buysellsignals.com/001051141660314596 Bearish SignalsDowntrend- The Moving Average Convergence Divergence (MACD) indicator of 12-day Exponential Moving Average (EMA) of 81.12 minus the 26-day EMA of 81.26 is negative 0.15 suggesting a bearish signal. Both EMA prices are falling, another bearish signal.- The present value of Rs1,000 (PV1000) invested one year ago in Future Retail Limited is Rs447, including a capital loss of Rs556 and dividend reinvested of Rs3.
Bullish SignalsOversold/Bullish/Support Signals- The stock is oversold according to the Williams % R indicator of -85.5, suggesting the price is close to its 14-day low of Rs78.60.Fundamental measures by comparison with the sector average [in brackets] indicate Undervaluation:- Price/Earnings of 6.2 [24.2]. - Price to Book of 0.6 [1.4]. - Return on Equity 8.3% [4.5%].- Return on Assets 1.8% [1.2%].- Return on Capital Employed 23.1% [18.6%].- Dividend yield of 1.4% [1.1%].- Price to EBITDA of 0.6 [1.7].Other Bullish Signals:- Total Liabilities/EBITDA of 3.7 is comfortably below 5, this compares favourably with the Joseph Piotroski benchmark of 5. - The P/E of 6.2 multiplied by the P/NTA of 0.6 is 3.4. Being less than the Benjamin Graham benchmark of 22.5 the stock appears undervalued. - The company is cash rich with Cash to Market Capitalisation at 11.7%. - Tobin's Q Ratio, defined as MCap divided by Total Assets, is 0.1. Compared with the rest of the market the stock is undervalued and ranks in the top 5% of stock by value of Q Ratio.- As per the Du Pont analysis, Return on Equity of 8.3% is better than sector average of 4.5%. This is computed as net profit margin of 1.4% times asset turnover [sales/assets] of 1.4 times leverage factor [total assets/shareholders' equity] of 4.5. Note- Future Retail Limited is at a discount of 56.3% to its 12-month high of Rs182.50 on 15 Mar, 2013. It is also at a premium of 26.5% to the 12-month low of Rs63.0 on 01 Aug, 2013.
